questions.question: What type of force is Viscous force?
What is the crucial assumption on velocity of the dropped object in this experiment?

answers.a: As soon as we release the ball the object attains the terminal velocity
answers.b: It takes very long time to attain the terminal velocity
answers.c: It will never reach the terminal velocity during the complete motion

questions.question: If you use a spherical shaped container in this experiment rather than a cylindrical one to hold the liquid, will you expect any change in the viscosity of the liquid or do you have to modify the formula used?

answers.a: Viscosity changes and formula has to be modified
answers.b: Viscosity changes but formula need not to be modified
answers.c: Viscosity will  not change and formula need not modified
answers.d: Viscosity will not change but formula has to be modified

questions.question: When an object is dropped in a liquid, what all are the forces acting on it?

answers.a: Force due to gravity, Buoyent force, viscous force
answers.b: Force due to gravity, Buoyent force

questions.question: Choose the correct statement about viscous force

answers.a: The viscous force is independent of velocity
answers.b: The viscous force depends on the velocity
answers.c: The viscous force is independent of density
